Tom Harris

Hello, welcome to my home page. I’m Tom, I live in Cambridge, UK, and I commission and edit maths books for CUP.
I’m a person who tries to be interested in things. The things I like to think about most are:

  • pure mathematics (PhD)
  • logic and formal systems in general
  • fiction
  • cultural studies (total amatuer)

Between 2011 and 2015 I did my PhD in algebraic K-theory with Dr. Bernhard Köck at the University of Southampton.
My thesis was about Grayson’s algebraic presentation of the higher algebraic K-groups.

For recreation, I like running, hiking, swimming outdoors, and reading books.

I post infrequently on Twitter and much more frequently on Mastodon. I put pictures on Instagram and interesting links on Pinboard.

Contact

The easiest way to get in touch with me is by email: tkmharris@gmail.com

PGP, if you’re feeling sneaky: https://keybase.io/tkmharris

Maths

Publications

  1. Algebraic proofs of some fundamental theorems in algebraic K-theory
    in Homology, Homotopy and Applications 17 (2015), no. 1, 267-280.

  2. Exterior power operations on higher K-groups via binary complexes
    (with Bernhard Köck and Lenny Taelman)
    in Annals of K-Theory 2-3 (2017), 409–450.

Other

Here are some notes on the Pisano semiperiod.

A series of seminars for undergraduates I started while I was a graduate student.

Blog

I’ve been keeping a blog for the last couple of years. There’s no particular topic: sometimes it’s reflections on things I’ve been reading or thinking about, but other times it’s more like a diary (especially if I’ve been somewhere interesting recently). I suppose the topic is “things I’d like to share with my friends”. That’s good enough, I think.
